intro: Diospyros chaffanjonii, commonly known as the Chaffanjon persimmon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ebenaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, smooth, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round, fleshy berry that turns from green to orange when mature. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
